text: What always happens when an exception is thrown
answers: The call stack is checked for an exception handler.
The program crashes
A separate program catches the exception
The program restarts

text: If an exception is not caught, the program will be terminated
answers: True
False

text: Which of the following is NOT a way to throw an exception
answers: Run code that has a syntax error
Create a FileReader for a file that doesn't exist.
Call a method of an undeclared object.
throw new Exception();

text: A try block must have a catch block
answers: False
True

text: When should a try block NOT be used
answers: When you want exceptions to be handled by whoever called this method.
When you want a method to handle its own exceptions.
When you want to run code that might thrown an exception.
When you are opening files.

text: What happens when an exception is thrown in a try block
answers: The program immediately executed the code of the catch block.
The program finishes executing the try block then continues to the catch block.
An error message is printed out that the try was unsuccessful.
The try block returns false.

text: When is the catch block run
answers: When the try block throws an exception the catch block can accept.
After the try block finishes running.
When any exception is thrown from the try block.
When an error is thrown that references the catch block.

text: Multiple catch blocks with different arguments can be defined
answers: True
False

text: What is wrong with the following code
answers: There is no name for the exception.
There is nothing in the body of the catch block.
Exception is not a specific type of exception.

text: What is the purpose of a finally block
answers: It can clean up since it is guaranteed to run.
It handles the case where no error is thrown in the try block.
It is used to finallize the program if an exception causes it to terminate.

text: What is the throws keyword used for
answers: It allows a method further up the call stack to handle an exception.
To create a new exception.
To specify what types of exceptions can be caught.
Yes
No
